TextView.android:text: Attempting to wholly understand this movement can truly be overwhelming. There is so much to learn and so much information readily available that it can often be confusing to know how to actually make a difference. If you are here reading and looking for ways to help out, you have already taken the first step of helping out. Being educated on this matter is highly important before you can go out and make change. Now that you have a decent understanding of what this movement is about, there are a few other steps you can take that would really help make an impact on the world.

The four key things that any person can do to help is to donate, sign petitions, show up to protests, and vote if you are old enough to. If you are able to do one or any or all of these things, it will be greatly appreciated by everyone and it will help make a truly lasting change in our country. It is time we see real change for all of these movements and down below is how you can do your part. It is also important to just reach out and check in on friends and family. Share your resources and have difficult conversations with the more close-minded people of our societies. Be an ally in any way possible because staying silent only adds to the oppressions that have already been going on for much too long.

Donating is a crucial part of every movement. Notable organizations already fully commit to this cause and do incredible work and even the smallest donation can help advance significant changes in our society. Aside from donating money, you can also donate your time to these organizations who are always looking for volunteers to help out.

Here are some websites to sign petitions and show your support for the Greenpeace movement. They are working towards saving endangered species and help regulate the climate and reverse human damage. If you can, take a few moments to sign these petitions and show your support for this movement.
Here is a website that provides many different links to sign petitions for specific Greenpeace movements you can look into and support: https://www.greenpeace.org/usa/take-action/

Greenpeace has been donating their time and money to help out countries in need during COVID-19, such as Brazil. They are strong believers that this virus can lead to many more deaths and could harm people if action isn't taken. They are fighting for less ignorance, for more action taken to prevent more deaths. In the midst of a pandemic, they are still looking for ways to help reverse the effects of climate change, prevent deforestation, and protect endangered species from going extinct. It all starts with the government, and their willingness to help. In order for the government to hear, they need your support and your voice, so visit their page and find ways to take action. https://www.greenpeace.org/international/

The most powerful voice is from the people. The strongest protection of this planet is from the people. Reading more about the science behind global warming, climate change, ocean conservation, and all the movements Greenpeace is working to support will shed light on how much Americans do not prioritize the health of this world. It is important to support these movements, and the best way to do it is to vote for officials that put the environment as a high priority. Without a clean earth, there is nothing to leave for our children and grandchildren other than a mess of extra problems. Not just for the health of future generations, it’s important to care for the health of helpless creatures and prevent their extinction. By supporting officials that care about environmental preservation, you are taking a step to help the world.
